poem:
Title: "Of Boules and Brogues"

In London's clamour, quiet cues, 
Petanque's silver sphere imbues,
The fickle fashion, shifting rues,
Gazelles to Sambas, changing views.

A sport uncool, ascends anew,
Among the fleeting trends accrue,
Metropolitan ado,
A ballet of boules in city's stew.

Distractions, distractions, yet imbued,
In quiet lanes, in silence viewed,
A game of petanque, life pursued,
With every toss, existence skewed.
